name: lib/arcstore.js
ArcStore
description:
Table that contains all living sockets that might be in use. Peers can
comprise multiples protocols that may use multiple times an arc.

name: insert
description: ProtocolId adds another arc leading to peerId in the store

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the
socket.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that adds the
arc.

params.name: socket
params.description:
The WebRTC socket. Can be null if the socket to
peerId is known to be in the store.

name: remove
description: ProtocolId removes an arc to the peerId.

unknown.tagValue:
{ELiving} The entry if no protocol is using the socket, null
otherwise.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer accessible through the
arc to delete.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
remove the arc.

return.description:
The entry if no protocol is using the socket, null
otherwise.

name: removeAll
description: ProtocolId removes all its arcs.

unknown.tagValue:
{object[]} Objects comprising {peer, socket, occ}; peer being
the identifier of the peer reachable through the socket, socket being a 
WebRTC connection that is not used by any protocols, null if protocols
still use it, occ being the number of arcs removed by protocolId.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
remove all its arcs.

return.description:
Objects comprising {peer, socket, occ}; peer being
the identifier of the peer reachable through the socket, socket being a 
WebRTC connection that is not used by any protocols, null if protocols
still use it, occ being the number of arcs removed by protocolId.

name: removePeer
description: Remove all arcs leading to peerId.

unknown.tagValue:
{Map} Map where key is the identifier of the protocol that sees
its arcs being removed, and value is the number of arcs removed;

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable by a WebRTC
connection to remove.

return.description:
Map where key is the identifier of the protocol that sees
its arcs being removed, and value is the number of arcs removed;

name: contains
description: Check if the store has at least one occurrence of the peer.

unknown.tagValue: {boolean} true if it exists, false otherwise.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer to check.

return.description: true if it exists, false otherwise.

name: get
description: Get the entry of the arc leading to PeerId

unknown.tagValue:
{ELiving} The entry containing peerId, null if it does not
exists.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the remote peer

return.description:
The entry containing peerId, null if it does not
exists.

name: lib/entries/edying.js
EDying
description: Entry of the dying table containing sockets being removed.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the
socket.

params.name: socket
params.description: The WebRTC socket.

params.name: timeout
params.description:
Time before the connexion is completely removed 
and destroyed.

name: lib/entries/eliving.js
ELiving
description: Entry of the living table containing sockets still in use.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the 
socket.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that creates an
arc to this peer using this socket. Protocols can have multiple arcs
leading to a same peer. Multiple protocols can share a same socket.

params.name: socket
params.description: The WebRTC socket.

name: increment
description: Add an occurrence of the arc to the protocol

params.name: protocolId
params.description: The identifier of the protocol.

name: decrement
description: Remove an occurrence of the arc to the protocol

unknown.tagValue:
{boolean} True if an arc has been remove, false if the protocol
do not have such arc.

params.name: protocolId
params.description: The identifier of the protocol.

return.description:
True if an arc has been remove, false if the protocol
do not have such arc.

name: sum
description: Count the number of arcs leading to this peer

unknown.tagValue:
{integer} The sum of occurrences of protocols using this
socket.

return.description:
The sum of occurrences of protocols using this
socket.

name: lib/entries/epending.js
EPending
description: Entry of the pending table containing sockets being created.

params.name: temporaryId
params.description: A temporary id used to retrieve the entry.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the
socket. Null if the peerId is yet to be known.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
establish the connexion.

params.name: socket
params.description: The WebRTC socket.

params.name: timeout
params.description: Maximum time for a connexion to establish.

name: lib/exceptions/exincompletemessage.js
ExIncompleteMessage
description: Exception thrown when the message does not have the required data.

params.name: source
params.description: The name of the function that threw the exception.

params.name: entry
params.description:
The entry that requested more
information.

params.name: message
params.description: The message lacking data.

name: lib/exceptions/exlatemessage.js
ExLateMessage
description:
Exception that fires when a message arrives too late and the entry in the
table has already been purged.

params.name: source
params.description: The function name that throw the exception.

params.name: message
params.description: The late message

name: lib/exceptions/exprotocolexists.js
ExProtocolExists
description:
Exception that rise when a protocol registers and its identifier already
exists in registered protocols of neighborhood-wrtc.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that already
exists

name: lib/exceptions/exsocketnotfound.js
ExSocketNotFound
description:
Exception that fires when trying to access or use a socket that does not
exist.

params.name: source
params.description: The source of the exception.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that has been tried.

params.name: protocolId
params.description: The identifier of the protocol that failed.

params.name: message
params.description: A error message.

name: lib/exceptions/exundefinedfunction.js
ExUndefinedFunction
description:
Exception that fires when the interface of the protocol using neighborhood is
not complete.

params.name: source
params.description: The function name that is not provided.

name: lib/interfaces/ineighborhood.js
INeighborhood
description:
Interface of functions that are available to a protocol that registered
to this module.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that created this
interface.

params.name: connect
params.description:
The connection function provided by this
module.

params.name: disconnect
params.description:
The disconnection function provided by this
module.

params.name: send
params.description: The send function provided by this module.

name: connect
description: Create a WebRTC connexion.

params.name: arg1
params.description:
Either a callback function to send the
message to the remote peer (for instance, it can use a signaling server
or the already created WebRTC connexions), or a message received from the
remote peer.

params.name: arg2
params.description:
The message received from a peer that initialized a 
WebRTC connexion.

name: disconnect
description: Remove an arc that led to peerId.

unknown.tagValue: {promise} Resolved when the arc is removed.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the remote peer.

return.description: Resolved when the arc is removed.

name: send
description: Send message to peerId.

unknown.tagValue:
{promise} Resolved when the message is sent, reject
otherwise. Note that loss of messages is not handled by default.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the remote peer.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to send.

params.name: retry
params.description:
Retry few times to send the message before
giving up.

return.description:
Resolved when the message is sent, reject
otherwise. Note that loss of messages is not handled by default.

name: lib/interfaces/iprotocol.js
IProtocol
description:
An interface for protocols that checks if all functions have been provided.
Not fully necessary since it will only be checked at runtime anyway.

name: _pid
description: Get the identifier of the protocol

name: _connected
description: Behavior when an arc leading to peer has been established.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the 
arc.

params.name: isOutgoing
params.description:
State whether or not the added arc is an 
outgoing arc.

name: _disconnected
description: Behavior when an arc leading to peer has been disconnected.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer reachable through the
arc.

name: _failed
description: Behavior when an arc failed to establish properly.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that we tried to
establish a connection with.

params.name: isOutgoing
params.description:
State whether or not the failed arc was 
supposed to be an outgoing arc.

name: _received
description: Behavior when a message from peerId has been received.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message.

params.name: message
params.description: The received message.

name: _streamed
description: Behavior when a stream from peerId is being received.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message.

params.name: stream
params.description: The received stream.

name: lib/messages/mrequest.js
MRequest
description: The message containing the request to create a WebRTC connexion

params.name: temporaryId
params.description:
A temporary identifier during the socket
creation. The key will be changed to peerId when the connexion is
established successfully.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that will be reachable
through the socket being created. Null if it is yet to be known.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol to route 
messages.

params.name: offer
params.description:
The WebRTC offer containing ways to establish a
direct peer-to-peer connexions. See WebRTC for more information.

name: lib/messages/mresponse.js
MResponse
description: The message containing the response to create a WebRTC connexion

params.name: temporaryId
params.description:
A temporary identifier during the socket
creation. The key will be changed to peerId when the connexion is established
successfully.

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer that will be reachable
through the socket being created. Null if it is yet to be known.

params.name: protocolId
params.description: The identifier of the protocol to route messages.

params.name: offer
params.description:
The WebRTC offer containing ways to establish a direct 
peer-to-peer connexions. See WebRTC for more information.

name: lib/messages/msend.js
MSend
description:
Message sent when protocolId wishes to send payload. It is a basic
encapsualtion of protocolId.

params.name: peerId
params.description: The identifier of the peer that sent the message

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that sent the
message

params.name: payload
params.description: The payload of the message.

name: lib/neighborhood.js
Neighborhood
description:
Easy-to-use interface to establish multiple WebRTC connections using
SimplePeer (npm: simple-peer)

params.name: options
params.description:
the options available to the connections, e.g.
timeout before

params.name: options.socketClass
params.description: simple-peer default socket class (usefull if you need to change the type of socket)

params.name: options.config
params.description: simple-peer options

params.name: options.timeout
params.description:
Time to wait (in milliseconds)
before neighborhood-wrtc assumes that a connection establishment failed,
or before an unused connection is removed.

params.name: options.encoding
params.description:
Method to customize message sent,
default: return JSON.stringify(data);

params.name: options.decoding
params.description:
Method to decode a received message,
default: return JSON.parse(data);

name: register
description:
The protocolId asks this module to get an interface. The interface
comprises functions such as connect, disconnect, or send. ProtocolId
should provide some functions as well such as failed, opened, received,
pid.

unknown.tagValue: {INeighborhood} The interface to use this module easily.

params.name: protocol
params.description: The protocol that requires the interface.

return.description: The interface to use this module easily.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
establish an new connection.

params.name: arg1
params.description:
Either a callback function to send the
message to the remote peer (for instance, it can use a signaling server
or the already created WebRTC connexions), or a message received from the
remote peer.

params.name: arg2
params.description:
The message received from a peer that initialized a
WebRTC connection.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that creates a
connection.

params.name: sender
params.description: A function called at each offer

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
open a connection.

params.name: msg
params.description: The message containing an offer, a peerId etc.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that wishes to
create a connection.

params.name: sender
params.description:
The function that send the offer to the remote
initiating peer.

params.name: msg
params.description: The request message containing offers, peerId, etc.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol that removes an
arc

params.name: peerId
params.description:
The identifier of the peer. If no arg,
remove all arcs of protocolId.

unknown.tagValue:
{promise} Resolved when the message is sent, reject
otherwise. Note that loss of messages is not handled by default.

params.name: protocolId
params.description:
The identifier of the protocol sending the
message

params.name: peerId
params.description: The remote peer to send the message to.

params.name: message
params.description: The message to send.

params.name: retry
params.description:
Retry few times to send the message before
giving up.

return.description:
Resolved when the message is sent, reject
otherwise. Note that loss of messages is not handled by default.
